column4: i have a question about setting up and using ad-hoc wireless networks...
is there an easy way to use a wireless network discovered by "iwlist ath0 scan"
i know you can set up profiles in /etc/network/interfaces, but i was looking more for a way to join a wireless network just as i'm running around
you could grep the iwlist output and join the essid
so would i just enter "iwconfig ath0 essid linksys" for example?
then how would i start the interface?  using "ifup ath0" uses the /etc/network/interfaces file
once i use "iwconfig ath0 essid linksys" for example, how do i start the interface?
I don't want to tell you non-ubuntu stuff
let me try your idea, thanks
better listen to this folks
this didn't work... "sudo iwconfig ath0 essid Maicubic ap 00:0C:41:76:9F:6E IP up"
don't bother with the ap
it gave me the error "Error : unrecognised wireless request "up""
so the question is, how do you start a wireless network without using "ifup"?
do i have to specify an IP?  or can i just use DHCP?
you don't know if that network has a dhcp server
so i should guess an IP address, huh?
it's your choice
thanks, let me try this out.  brb
then using "nmap -sP 192.168.0.*" only yields my own IP address being up...
but i'm still having trouble getting it to work.  i see that i am getting a signal % in the gnome wireless applet, but can't get an IP or connection
